insights.title: Core conditions for uniform convergence
insights.takeaway: Uniform convergence typically requires controlling model capacity (e.g., via VC-dimension or Rademacher complexity) and sample size; this underpins generalization guarantees.
bullets: Capacity control prevents overfitting to noise.
Sample complexity bounds suggest data thresholds.
action_items: Review VC-dim examples for your model class.
Compute/estimate Rademacher bounds for a toy setup.
